definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: Barbecue smoke took flight from the Kaufmans' backyard.
sentences.chinese: 从考夫曼家的后院里，升腾起烧烤的烟气。

sentences.english: Plumes of black smoke rose from burning industrial plants.
sentences.chinese: 黑色烟柱从燃烧的工厂升腾而去。

sentences.english: Ashes of new homes, is gathering a new hope.
sentences.chinese: 浴火重生的新家园，正汇聚升腾起新的希望。

sentences.english: On her right side is a twisting dragon rising to the sky.
sentences.chinese: 她左边一条体态扭曲的龙，正向上升腾。

sentences.english: When you saw the five-star-red-flag rising on Hong Kong's land, what do you think of?
sentences.chinese: 当你看到五星红旗升腾在香港的土地，做何感想？

sentences.english: Steam within the primary loop, now no longer circulating with the water, rises.
sentences.chinese: 主回路中的蒸汽，不再同水一起循环，而是升腾起来。

sentences.english: We saw the face of evil form in plumes of smoke and ash.
sentences.chinese: 在废墟和烟雾升腾中我们似乎看到了魔鬼的脸孔。

sentences.english: The sparks shot up like thousands of shooting stars into the still night air.
sentences.chinese: 火花升腾像数千流星冲入寂静的夜空。

sentences.english: Plumes1) of white steam rise from the ground nearby.
sentences.chinese: 身边，缕缕白雾从地面升腾而起，徐徐缭绕。

sentences.english: When we arrived, the fire was mushrooming upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 我们来到时，火正向楼上呈蘑菇状升腾。

sentences.english: GaoHong face WenYan, heart and rising out of mother love and WenYan shed.
sentences.chinese: 高虹面对文彦，心中又升腾出母爱和对文彦的不舍。

sentences.english: I took a picture of him as the cloud of dust and debris swelled.
sentences.chinese: 尘埃和碎片云一样升腾时，我给他拍了张照片。

definition: (of a vapor etc) to rise/to hang in the air
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
